isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - BACKUP LIGHT FUNCTION

svcproc.title: BACKUP LIGHT FUNCTION
svcproc.para: The backup light function is controlled by the WTEC III ECU using the backup relay (639) located at the rear of the cab with 2000, 4000, 8000 and on the platform with 3600, 3800 and 4000FBC. When the transmission is in reverse and the key switch (24) is in the ignition position, power from fuse F1 flows through circuit 71, connector (2), circuit 71, connector (304), circuit 71, connector (631), and circuit 72 to the backup relay (639) at terminal 30. Ignition power from fuse 301 is applied to the backup relay at terminal 85 by way of circuit 146, connector (418) and circuit 146.

When the WTEC III ECU determines the transmission is in REVERSE, the ECU applies a ground to circuit 113 going to the backup relay (terminal 86), causing the backup relay to energize. With the relay energized, power from fuse F1 (present at backup relay terminal 30) flows through the relay and out terminal 87 through circuit 71A, connector (631), circuit 71A, connector (304), circuit 71A, connector (2), and circuit 71B/71A to connector (13).

To summarize the backup light system: whenever the ignition switch is on, ignition power is supplied to backup relay terminal 85, and to back up relay terminal 30. With the transmission in reverse, the WTEC III ECU applies a ground causing the backup relay to energize and power is supplied from the backup relay terminal 87 to the rear cab connector (13).
